summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackCurlsmith Curl Conditioning Oil-In-Cream is a rich leave-in conditioner perfect for protective styles or to add moisture to coarse, very thirsty hair.
details: DetailsBenefitsDelivers deep moisture and hydrationMakes hair soft, smooth and shinyGreat for the LOC (Liquid Oil Cream) or LCO (Liquid Cream Oil) MethodExcellent cream for braids, twist-outs and other protective stylesPrimes the hair and preps for styling productsRich concentrated texture - a little goes a long waySuitable for coarse, high porosity or dry hairVegan, cruelty free, clean ingredients and curly girl friendlyDesigned for all curls and texture typesKey IngredientsShea butter to lock in moistureCoconut, Olive and Sunflower oil for ultimate nourishmentCarrot and Sesame oil to help prevent moisture lossResurrection flower (aka Rose of Jericho), desert plant that survives up to 3 years without water, known for its moisture-retention propertiesAndiroba, indigenous plant of the Amazon forest known for its nourishing propertiesAloe, Sage, Rosemary, Pepper and Basil extracts, known for their antioxidant propertiesFormulated WithoutSulfatesSiliconesDrying alcoholsItem 2524535How To UseAfter your shower, divide wet hair into sections, rake and smooth through until all strands are coated. Try not to use too much product at first as you need to realize how thirsty your curls are. Do not rinse out. Proceed with your preferred styling method, then diffuse or air dry to reveal soft, hydrated curls.IngredientsWater (Aqua/Eau), Glycerin, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, Glyceryl Stearate, Cetearyl Alcohol, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil*, Sesamum Indicum (Sesame) Seed Oil, Carapa Guaianensis (Andiroba) Seed Oil, Olea Europaea (Olive) Fruit Oil*, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Juice, Ocimum Basilicum (Basil) Leaf Extract, Daucus Carota Sativa (Carrot) Root Extract*, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Rosmarinus Officinalis (Rosemary) Leaf Extract, Piper Nigrum (Black Pepper) Seed Extract, Salvia Officinalis (Sage) Leaf Extract, Selaginella Lepidophylla (Resurrection Flower) Extract, Dicaprylyl Ether, Cetyl Alcohol, Laurylalcohol, Myristyl Alcohol, Cetrimonium Chloride, Guar Hydroxypropyltrimonium Chloride, Polyquaternium-10, Panthenol, Tocopherol, Glyceryl Undecylenate, Citric Acid, Sodium Hydroxide, Disodium Edta, Glyceryl Caprylate, Potassium Sorbate, Sodium Benzoate, Fragrance (Parfum), Limonene, Linalool. *Certified Organic Ingredient
how_to_use: After your shower, divide wet hair into sections, rake and smooth through until all strands are coated. Try not to use too much product at first as you need to realize how thirsty your curls are. Do not rinse out. Proceed with your preferred styling method, then diffuse or air dry to reveal soft, hydrated curls.

reviews.headline: Dried hair out
reviews.comments: I love the curl soufflé they have but this cream made my hair SO dry. So did the curl defining spray, AND the conditioner. I get good results as far as my waves go but concerned about how healthy it is. My hair feels like straw. Specifically using this

reviews.headline: Not for my hair
reviews.comments: My hair felt like straw. Unfortunately this didn't work for my hair. After a few hours my hair felt like I didn't put anything moisturizer on it. Luckily I bought the sample size

reviews.headline: My#1 go to leave in conditioner
reviews.comments: I love the way my hair feels and looks. It's so moisturizing. It doesn't take much, to go along way.

reviews.headline: My #1 go to moisturizer
reviews.comments: I'm so thankful to God for this moisturizer, it's definitely my go to and when Ulta puts it on sale, I try to stock up on it. Although the price is a bit pricey, I'm still an active fan and user.

reviews.headline: Gorgeous
reviews.comments: Not oily or sticky and leaves hair looking very smooth and frizz free. For me, however, I do have to add an oilier product to the ends to keep those down. I prefer this cream to the spray.

reviews.headline: PACKAGING ISSUE-16oz bottle
reviews.comments: 16 oz package issue-The product is too dense to come out through the nozzle-so I removed the cap and attempt to squeeze it out.  I can't get any product out of the bottle.

reviews.headline: Great cream for curly hair
reviews.comments: Love this! Second time I bought it. Leaves my hair curly not dry. A little goes a long way.

reviews.headline: I've been enlightened
reviews.comments: I have thicccc kinky (4a/b) hair that I've struggled with caring for since I was a kid. Issues with dryness, not getting curl definition, easily tangled, etc. Going through so many products and techniques over the years, this is the only time I've actually been blown away with the results. I've been growing my hair out after being bald for years, with it now being maybe 8-10 inches of pure beautiful fro. I ended up grabbing this product along with their moisture shampoo+conditioner, and not only were the effects there from the get-go, but LASTED. Every day for a week I'd get up, throw the bonnet off and be shocked with how soft and moisturized my hair was. My curls were more defined than with any product I've used in the past (still a fro, but the curls were there!) and the hair stayed detangled. Plus it smells amazing!! while I can see why price point might be an issue for some, I think it's worth every penny.

reviews.headline: Definitely a must
reviews.comments: No more frizz. Makes curls look great!

reviews.headline: Great Product
reviews.comments: Great for mixed hair types

reviews.headline: Leave in
reviews.comments: First time using curlsmith this one of their best products. Can use on all different hair types,a little goings a long way. Good price and always have a sale and like that. It's very moisturizing, smell good and have a awesome shine

reviews.headline: Very good option if you're silicone-free
reviews.comments:
Great shea-based leave in for those who don't like silicones. Conditions hair and provides lasting moisture retention, softness and managability.

My one gripe is that it's so expensive for what it is, there as drugstore leave ins with similar ingredients for half the price. The massive inclusion of all these different oils feels unecessary and don't really help the effectiveness of this formula. The only Curlsmith products I'd deem worth the high price tag would be the multi-tasking conditioner and co-wash.

reviews.headline: All hair type
reviews.comments: Great product the entire family use this product. A little goes a long way, very moisturizing and give that shine. Great prices will buy more and tell others about the product.  Love that it made with natural ingredients

reviews.headline: I would buy this product again
reviews.comments: This was a good product to leave in. I saw immediate resukts

reviews.headline: I would buy this product over and over again
reviews.comments: My hair love it.

reviews.headline: Not for my hair
reviews.comments: It made my hair feel coarse - while on it, after it was rinsed out. And it felt horrible after it dried. My hair is thick (a lot of it, and thick strands), and a 2c/3a combo. This was not for me!

reviews.headline: Great product for when you're fresh out of the shower!
reviews.comments: I love this product! I use it on my wash days. It is thick and creamy, which I love for my very thick and wavy/curly-ish hair. If you have thin hair, this might be too heavy, but it is perfect for thick waves or curls! It adds moisture and a nice hold. This was one of my first Curlsmith products, and I still love it. I've graduated to the jumbo bottle!

reviews.headline: Very surprised with this product!
reviews.comments: I was very surprised with this product. I recently discovered I have a tree nut allergy so was looking for new products in my hair - I also just moved to a way hotter climate, and so was trying to tame my wash and go's. This product with Uncle Funky's Daughter and Innersense was AMAZING. I have type 3c/4a hair and my wash and go lasted a week - best wash and go I've ever had. I even went to the gym!

reviews.headline: so moisturizing and great for braids and protective styles
reviews.comments: this is really the best all in one product. I use this on my 4 yr old niece's hair before braiding it. Her mom asked what did I use on hair because it was still soft and moisturized after being braided for more than 4 weeks. I use a little on wash day while her hair is air drying.  I don't get the negative reviews.  Maybe they aren't following the directions.  It does say to use for protective styles.

reviews.headline: Love it
reviews.comments: Great buy

media.headline: Best Line I've Tried So Far!!

faceoff_positive.comments: I am 6 months in to going natural and have easily spent 1K in products so far. This line blew me away!!! The smell is divine!! Very light and not too overwhelming. It's very lightweight yet hydrating  on my hair which is important to me since I have LP hair. It's line is fabulous!! I can't say enough good things about it.
faceoff_positive.headline: Best Line I've Tried So Far!!

faceoff_negative.comments:
I don't get why this is getting such good reviews. I got both this and the CurlSmith Souffle. It doesn't do anything for my 3B curly hair. After seeing the amazing results people were posting online, I wanted to try this (have been using DevaCurl for over a decade). 
- You have to use a LOT of product. Way more than previous DC products I have used. Even then...
- By the end of wash day, it already looks like I'm not wearing any product on my hair at all. By the end of the day, my hair loses definition and starts to frizz. Day 2 hair looks dull and undefined. Day 3 hair looks like I've been crawling in a cave for 5 years. 
- The bottle is super cheap - like a 25-cent water bottle thickness. You have to really squeeze to get the product out, and I think I'm one squeeze away from cracking it. 

Bottom line - if this was a drugstore product labeled "curly" I'd give it 3 stars. But this is not drugstore priced. Can't wait to get to the bottom of it and return my hair to the DevaCurl products that I know and trust.
faceoff_negative.headline: Just MEH
